description: A short lesson to help you apply Abduction: Inference to the Best Explanation.

buildup.text: Abductive reasoning picks the best explanation for an observation from competing possibilities.

discovery.text: Charles Peirce coined it in the 1890s. It's how doctors diagnose, detectives solve, and scientists hypothesize.

twist.text: The 'best' explanation isn't necessarily true. It's just the simplest one that fits all the facts â€” so far.

climax.text: Sherlock Holmes didn't do deduction. His famous method was abduction â€” inference to the best explanation.

punchline.text: Eliminate the impossible. Whatever remains is probably true.
